body.p: Haly was born in County Cork, Ireland in 1826. He emigrated to New York as a child and moved to Cincinnati before settling down in Frankfort, Kentucky in 1852. He was employed as a builder and constructed many buildings in Frankfort and throughout Kentucky. He built the Farmers Bank, the east wing of the Capitol Building in Frankfort and the City Hall among other constructions. Haly died on October 27, 1890 in Frankfort, Kentucky.
